name: Amitriptyline (Elavil)
summary: A tricyclic antidepressant used for depression, chronic pain, migraine prevention, and certain anxiety disorders.
description: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) that inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine, increasing their synaptic concentrations. It also has significant anticholinergic, antihistaminic, and alpha-adrenergic blocking properties, contributing to its side effect profile. Once widely prescribed for depression, it is now more commonly used at lower doses for chronic neuropathic pain, migraine prophylaxis, and insomnia.

sections.text: Inhibits serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake transporters, increasing monoamine concentrations in the synaptic cleft. Also exhibits strong antihistamine and anticholinergic effects.

adult.start: 25–50 mg at bedtime for depression; 10–25 mg at bedtime for pain or migraine prevention
adult.titrate: Increase by 25–50 mg every 3–7 days as tolerated
adult.usual_range: 75–150 mg/day for depression; 10–75 mg/day for off-label uses

sections.geriatric: Start at 10–25 mg at bedtime; titrate slowly
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; lower doses may be required
sections.renal_impairment: No dose adjustment necessary in mild/moderate impairment

items: Tablets: 10 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg, 75 mg, 100 mg, 150 mg

sections.text: Antidepressant effects may take 2–4 weeks; analgesic and sedative effects may appear within days.

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: Overdose can be life-threatening due to cardiotoxicity
Caution in elderly due to fall risk

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks; neonatal withdrawal possible.
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; may cause sedation in infant.
sections.pediatrics: Not typically used for depression in children; may be used for migraine prophylaxis under specialist care.
sections.geriatrics: High anticholinergic risk; start low and go slow.

sections.text: Reduce dose gradually over 1–2 weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

items: Often used at low doses for insomnia and chronic pain rather than depression.
Avoid in patients with significant cardiac conduction disease.
One of the most sedating TCAs.
